meanings.definition: A natural earth containing iron oxide and manganese oxide, typically dark yellowish-brown in color.
meanings.sent1: The artist used umber to create the shadows in the painting.
meanings.sent2: The soil had a rich umber hue due to the minerals present.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel rolled around in the umber dirt, leaving a trail of brown paw prints.
meanings.sent4: As the storm clouds gathered, the sky took on an umber tone, signaling the impending rain.
meanings.sent5: The ancient cave paintings were preserved in the deep umber caves, protected from the elements.

meanings.sent1: Her hair shone with an umber brilliance in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The old book had faded to a soft umber over the years.
meanings.sent3: The chocolate cake was so rich and umber, it seemed almost sinful to eat.
meanings.sent4: The forest floor was carpeted in an umber blanket of fallen leaves.
meanings.sent5: The old wooden chest was painted in a deep umber, giving it an air of elegance.
